thread.title: Best burgers in Melbourne, Surfers Paradise & Noosa | Australia’s best
thread.title_full: Best burgers in Melbourne, Surfers Paradise & Noosa | Australia’s best

author: KATE SCHNEIDER
title: Best burgers in Melbourne, Surfers Paradise & Noosa | Australia’s best
text:
FORGET fast food chains. A list of the best places to chomp down on a burger around the nation has been released by TripAdvisor, and it has unwrapped some hidden gastronomic gems.
The winner out of the lot was the Burger Lounge in the coastal Queensland town of Coolangatta, which made a whopping impression with its delicious offerings.
In fact, the list was dominated by the sunshine state which scored six out of the 10 spots. Shockingly, NSW, the Northern Territory, ACT and Western Australia all failed to impress, without a single mention on the list.
YOUR SAY: Where is Australia’s best burger? Tell us below
Standout burgers on the list include the monster 1.8 kilogram “Phat Bastard Burger” found at Long boards Laidback Eatery & Bar in Surfers Paradise, or if that doesn’t hit the spot you can snap up the Crickey’s Burger, which is made of crocodile meat, at Off The Track in Port Douglas.
The rankings were determined according to reviews and opinions submitted on the site, taking into account the quality, quantity and ratio of the reviews submitted over an 18-month period.
So here’s the full list of winners, and what visitors had to say about them.
The top 10 list:
1. Burger Lounge, Coolangatta, Queensland
Home to the best American style hamburgers in the nation, make sure you order the buffalo wings as a side.
2. Off The Track, Port Douglas, Queensland
It may be off the beaten track, but it’s worth the detour, with its offerings including the Texan Burger and the Crickey’s Burger made of crocodile meat.
Get off the beaten track and find some delicious rewards. Picture: TripAdvisor Source: Supplied
3. Long boards Laidback Eatery & Bar, Surfers Paradise, Queensland
There are 20 burger options here including the bluntly named, giant “Phat Bastard Burger”.
A huge meal at Longboards. Picture: TripAdvisor Source: Supplied
4. The Burger Bar — Noosa, Queensland
Vegans, vegetarians and meat lovers will all be satisfied here.
The Burger Bar will appeal to all. Picture: TripAdvisor Source: Supplied
5. The Bottle of Milk — Lorne, Victoria
Located along the Great Ocean Road, it’s worth the stop over. Everything is so fresh, and don’t forget to try a milkshake.
Fresh is best at The Bottle of Milk. Picture: TripAdvisor Source: Supplied
6. Nosh Express, Noosa, Queensland
This gem is located on the popular Hastings Street in Noosa. A favourite is the New York Burger, and their salads are worth a try.
7. Betty’s Burgers & Concrete Co. — Noosa, Queensland
Also found on Hastings Street, grab a classic Betty burger with Angus beef and special sauce, and leave room for a homemade desert such as waffles or apple pie.
Homemade goodness at Betty’s Burgers. Picture: TripAdvisor Source: Supplied
8. Nordburger — Norwood, South Australia
Located on the Parade in Adelaide, Nordburger offer’s the fusion of an America cheeseburger with a basket of Buttermilk fired chicken tenderloins. Oh, and there’s also chilli chips with beef pieces and topped with cheese.
Don’t forget to order the chilli chips at Nordburger. Picture: TripAdvisor Source: Supplied
9. Georges Hamburger Shop — Bairnsdale, Victoria
While it’s not a gourmet place, Georges does good old fashion hamburgers and is loved by locals.
10. 8bit — Melbourne, Victoria
Located in Footscray and themed in circa 80s arcade video games symbol, 8bit serves fine hamburgers, milkshakes fries and hotdogs. And if you’re feeling ravenous, there’s the Double Dragon which includes double beef, double cheese, double bacon, pickles, mustard, lettuce and topped with 8bit sauce.
8bit is more than a bit delicious. Picture: TripAdvisor Source: Supplied
